summary: U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement has a number of detention facilities around the country. As of March 2021, ICE had confirmed over 10,000 cases of COVID-19 among detainees within its detention facilities, and recorded 8 deaths. We reviewed how ICE has responded to COVID-19 in its detention facilities. We found that ICE has developed protocols to address things like facility intake processing, screening and testing...
title: Immigration Detention: ICE Efforts to Address COVID-19 in Detention Facilities
